lines.text: Lunch is poured!
Leave it to me! I'll get you to Paris if I have to start another war!

[Words from Kentucky's Journal read by Ginger]
Love! Beautiful love! Will it sweep me away in a cloud of glory or steal upon me... gently?
If you think there's anything *gentle* about love... you've never been necked by a Freshman!
Love is a battle, dearie! Every woman for herself... and Heaven help the men!
Hold fire till you see the whites of their eyes... then aim for the heart!
Don't blame yourself, Gil. Somehow I forgot everything in the world... except that I loved you.
There's something in my pocket. Dig in for it.
How's that for advertising? It's my Dad's new radio idea!
Some jazz they're playing! Your Dad sure says it with a big brass band!
That's his motto, Gil! Come on... let's dance!
All together, children... what are *our* thoughts on leaving school?
Men! Men! Men! Men! MEN!
I've been taught never to play with dynamite.
Dynamite isn't dangerous... if you know how to handle it.
Please, Mister... give the little girl a hand.
Afraid of storms?
There's no need of acting, Billie. We understand each other.
[Billie breaks away from Abbott's embrace]
What's the matter? I thought you were a 'modern'.

[Abbott stops forcing himself on Billie]
I knew you were... too decent!
It's not *decency*! I just don't want you!
You see... Gil has just found out something about me, something terribly disgraceful. Don't you understand, Dad... he couldn't possibly have me as a wife now.
What do you think of a groomless honeymoon? Modern, isn't it? I'm just starting the fashion.
Do tell us... is this a modern moral... or just another immoral modern?
Do you think you'd know the difference, darling?
